description.narrative: Children and adolescents grow up in enabling environments that promote improved nutrition.,which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, child and adolescent malnutrition in all its forms is reduced, with a special focus on overweight and obesity.

mailing-address.narrative: Paseo de la Reforma 645 Col. Lomas de Chapultepec México D.F. 11000

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Prevention of undernutrition in middle childhood (5 to 9 years)
Technical assistance - Adolescent health and nutrition
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

Mexico 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents grow up in enabling environments that promote improved nutrition.

baseline.value: Guidelines for food and beverage distribution in schools under review

target.value: 2025:National guidelines for food and beverage distribution in schools updated with concrete action towards preventing overweight and obesity with UNICEF¿s technical assistance

title.narrative: Approval of regulation on food and beverage marketing to children through UNICEF technical assistance

baseline.value: Inexistence of regulation on food and beverage marketing to children

target.value: 2025:Regulation on food and beverage marketing to children approved and enforced with child-sensitive considerations with UNICEF¿s technical assistance

baseline.value: NOM 051 updated with a clear front of pack warning label according to international standards
